Picking the ideal camera for time-lapse projects involves a bit of planning. Most importantly, considering factors like impeccable image quality, a promising battery life, intervalometer functionality, and durability. There are a whole lot of options out there for projects in this category and we’ve shortlisted them for you. Let’s get to it!

Time-lapse is the art of captivating long moments of progression by taking a series of images at set intervals and stitching them together to create a video that speeds up slow processes. From blooming flowers to busy construction sites, these videos give you an extraordinary view of events. 

Best Cameras for Time-Lapse Photography

1. Nikon Z8

Nikon Z8 – 45.7MP full-frame sensor and a beefy camera that works brilliantly for time-lapse. Although it has no built-in intervalometer, it can be paired with an external device like LRTimelapse Pro Timer 3 for precise control.

2. Panasonic Lumix GH7

Lumix GH7 – 25.2MP Micro Four Thirds sensor. Great for video and time-lapse. Compact and versatile with in-body image stabilization for smooth footage in tough conditions.

3. Canon EOS R7

Canon EOS R7 – 32.5MP APS-C sensor. A balance of resolution and portability. Articulated screen and user-friendly interface for beginners and experienced photographers alike venturing into time-lapse projects.

4. Brinno TLC300

This user-friendly camera, which was designed specifically for time-lapse photography, simplifies the process immensely. Its long battery life for one and straightforward operation make it ideal for extended projects like monitoring construction sites. 

5. DJI Osmo Action 5 Pro

For those seeking versatility, this beast doubles as an action camera and a capable time-lapse device. Its rugged design and advanced stabilization features ensure high-quality footage in various environments. 

6. aTLi EON

Tailored for social media enthusiasts, offering remote access and live previews on your smartphone or computer. Its compact design and ease of use make it a popular choice for creative time-lapse projects. 

7. Tikee 4

This new contender stands out with its dual 6K cameras, capturing ultra-wide panoramic views with exceptional clarity. Powered by solar energy, it operates continuously, even in remote outdoor locations, making it ideal and the best choice for long-term projects. 

Quick Comparison

Here’s a quick overview of the lenses that are best suited for these events.

How to Choose the Right Time-Lapse Camera for You

1. Consider the Type of Time-Lapse You’re Shooting

Not all time-lapse projects are the same. Construction sites require long-term battery life and weatherproofing, while astrophotography needs a high ISO range and wide aperture lenses.

2. Battery Life and Power Supply

Some cameras, like the Brinno TLC300, can run for months on a single set of batteries, making them ideal for construction time-lapses. Others, like the Tikee 4, rely on solar power, ensuring uninterrupted shooting outdoors.

3. Intervalometer and External Triggers

A built-in intervalometer simplifies time-lapse photography. If your camera lacks one (like the Nikon Z8), external devices such as the LRTimelapse Pro Timer 3 can step in.

4. Resolution and Dynamic Range

Higher resolution doesn’t equate to better always, but it, without a doubt, helps in all that post-production cropping. Cameras like the Nikon Z8 (45.7MP) provide magnificent detail, while action cams like the DJI Osmo Action 5 Pro (4K video) offer better convenience and durability.

5. Lens Compatibility

A good wide-angle lens (like the Canon RF 16-28mm f/2.8L) is excellent for landscapes, while a telephoto lens (like the OM System 100-400mm) is ideal for capturing distant subjects.

Top Picks for Specific Use Cases

  • Best camera for long-term outdoor time-lapses: Tikee 4 (Solar-powered, 6K resolution)
  • Best budget time-lapse camera: Brinno TLC300 ($299, long battery life)
  • Best for astrophotography time-lapses: Nikon Z8 + Nikon Z 35mm f/1.2 S (Full-frame, wide aperture)
  • Best for construction site monitoring: Brinno TLC300 or Tikee 4
  • Best action camera for time-lapse: DJI Osmo Action 5 Pro
  • Best all-around time-lapse camera: Canon EOS R7 (Great resolution, built-in intervalometer)

Final Thoughts: 2025 Time-Lapse

2025 is going to be a great year for time-lapse. With a few launches on the horizon for cameras and lenses, there has never been an easier time to capture long exposures.

For pros, full-frame mirrorless cameras like the Nikon Z8 and Canon EOS R7 are the way to go. For hobbyists, the Brinno TLC300 and aTLi EON are affordable and do the job.

Now go get your gear, set your intervals, and let time work its magic—one frame at a time.
